chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

i: nat

p: nat

ll: list bool
v: Vector.t (list bool) n
st: (nat * Vector.t (list bool) n)%type

Goal:
(i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = b :: ll -> p = 1 + i -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a]-> st -> {b : nat | b < a /\ P // (1 + i, v[ll/x]) -[b]-> st}

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename

VectorSpec.uncons_cons : forall (a0 : ?A) (v0 : vec ?A ?n), VectorDef.uncons (a0 ## v0) = (a0, v0) where ?A : [n : nat a : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat b : bool ll : list bool v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat a : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat b : bool ll : list bool v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, vec ?A (l + r) -> vec ?A l * vec ?A r where ?A : [n : nat a : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat b : bool ll : list bool v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type]
pos_S_inv : forall p0 : pos (S ?n), (p0 = pos0) + {q0 : pos ?n | p0 = pos_nxt q0} where ?n : [n : nat a : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat b : bool ll : list bool v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
in_bsm_sss_push : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x])
bsm_state = fun n : nat => (nat * vec (list bool) n)%type : nat -> Set Arguments bsm_state _%nat_scope
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (q : nat) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_steps one_step P q st st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
subcode_cons_inj : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) (P : code X), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
in_code_subcode : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : code X), in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
sss_steps_output_fun : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (a b : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), sss_steps one_step P a st1 st2 /\ out_code (fst st2) P -> sss_steps one_step P b st1 st3 /\ out_code (fst st3) P -> a = b /\ st2 = st3
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
sss_steps_stop_fun : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : code instr) (a b : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), out_code (fst st2) P -> out_code (fst st3) P -> sss_steps one_step P a st1 st2 -> sss_steps one_step P b st1 st3 -> a = b /\ st2 = st3
subcode_sss_steps_stop : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (i : instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 : nat * data), (forall st : nat * data, ~ one_step i st1 st) -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> sss_steps one_step P k st1 st2 -> k = 0 /\ st1 = st2
sss_step_stall_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), sss_step_stall one_step P st -> {ii : instr | (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P /\ sss_stall one_step ii st} + {out_code (fst st) P}
subcode_cons_invert_left : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i : nat) (I : X) (l : list X), (i, I :: l) <sc Q -> (i, I :: nil) <sc Q /\ (S i, l) <sc Q
BSM_HALTING = fun P : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (i, s0) := s in let (P0, v) := s0 in sss_terminates (bsm_sss (n:=n)) (i, P0) (i, v) : BSM_PROBLEM -> Prop
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
sss_stall_step_stall : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_step_stall one_step P st
subcode_sss_subcode_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : code instr) (Q : nat * list instr) (p k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> sss_steps one_step P p st1 st2 -> sss_steps one_step Q k st1 st3 -> exists q : nat, k = p + q /\ sss_steps one_step Q q st2 st3
subcode_sss_progress_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : code instr) (Q : nat * list instr) (p : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> sss_progress one_step P st1 st2 -> sss_steps one_step Q p st1 st3 -> exists q : nat, q < p /\ sss_steps one_step Q q st2 st3
list_One_Zero_inj : forall (a b : nat) (l m : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l = list_repeat One b ++ Zero :: m -> a = b /\ l = m
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (ii : instr) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_step one_step P st st' -> one_step ii st st'
subcode_sss_steps_inv_1 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (i : instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), st1 <> st3 -> one_step i st1 st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> sss_steps one_step P k st1 st3 -> exists k' : nat, k = S k' /\ sss_steps one_step P k' st2 st3
sss_compute_step_out_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : code instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), st1 <> st2 -> out_code (fst st3) P -> sss_compute one_step P st1 st2 -> sss_steps one_step P k st1 st3 -> exists q : nat, q < k /\ sss_steps one_step P q st2 st3
